concise_definition: v. 指戳, 挖苦, 干预, 探查

definitions.explanation_en: To push or prod something with a finger, stick, or other pointed object, often lightly or repeatedly.
definitions.explanation_cn: 用手指、棍子或其他尖状物轻推或戳刺某物，通常为反复性的动作。
definitions.example_en: The child was poking the fire with a stick to make it burn brighter.
definitions.example_cn: 孩子用一根棍子戳着火堆，想让火燃得更旺。

definitions.explanation_en: To interfere or meddle in someone else's affairs, often in an annoying or intrusive way.
definitions.explanation_cn: 无端干涉或插手他人的事务，通常带有令人厌烦或侵扰的意味。
definitions.example_en: Stop poking into my personal life—I don't need your advice.
definitions.example_cn: 别总插手我的私事——我不需要你的建议。

definitions.explanation_en: To make fun of or tease someone in a light-hearted or sarcastic manner.
definitions.explanation_cn: 以轻松或讽刺的方式取笑或挖苦某人。
definitions.example_en: They were just poking fun at his old-fashioned hairstyle.
definitions.example_cn: 他们只是在拿他过时的发型开玩笑。

definitions.explanation_en: To search or investigate something by probing or examining closely, often in a casual or curious way.
definitions.explanation_cn: 通过仔细探查或检查来搜寻或调查某物，通常带有随意或好奇的性质。
definitions.example_en: She was poking around in the attic looking for old photos.
definitions.example_cn: 她正在阁楼里翻找旧照片。

comparison.analysis: “Prodding” (催促/轻推) 与 “poking” 在物理动作上相似，但更强调推动或促使某人采取行动，常用于隐喻语境（如催促决策）。而 “poking” 更多指轻戳或随意的接触，语气更随意甚至带点顽皮。
“Teasing” (戏弄) 专指以幽默或轻蔑的方式取笑他人，语义范围比 “poking” 更窄，且更聚焦于言语或社交互动。而 “poking” 可以是身体动作、干涉行为或言语戏弄，语义更广。
“Intruding” (侵入) 指未经允许进入私人空间或事务，带有明显的负面和侵犯性含义。而 “poking” 在表示干涉时语气较轻，有时甚至带有无心或玩笑性质，不必然构成严重冒犯。
